author: gabrielaxel
title: DAOJob: The HR Tooling for DAOs
description: DAOスペースの拡大に伴い、コントリビューターの必要性も高まっています。現在のジョブボードはリーチが限られており、DAOの運営に最適化されていません。

f6_assessments.q0: 問題点が明確で、解決策も提案されています。DAOという特殊な世界で人材を確保することは、現在のところ簡単なことではありませんが、成長のためには必要不可欠であるため、このプロジェクトのインパクトは大きいと言えます。必要な人材を獲得するためのシンプルで効果的なツールを持つことは、カルダノにとって明確な利点となり、持続的な成長を促進し、容易に拡張することができます。DAOスペースに興味のある熟練した人々は、最終的には仕事を見つけられるところに行くでしょう。したがって、この提案が課題を効果的に解決することに強く同意します。
f6_assessments.q1: このチームは、このプロジェクトを実現するために必要なすべてのスキルを持っており、検証のために長い経歴とLinkedinプロファイルを提供してくれました。この評価を書いている時点では、チームメンバーの1人のLinkedinプロフィールのリンクが切れていましたが、グーグル検索で必要な背景情報をすべて得ることができました。提案書は、実行可能なセグメントに非常に明確に分割されており、各セグメントの完了までに適切なタイムフレームが設定されているように思われます。また、予算もどのように使われるかが明確になっており、目標を達成するための合理的かつ現実的なものになっています。1つ懸念されるのは、要求された資金が12ヶ月間のプロジェクトの最初の3ヶ月間しかカバーしていないことです。このプロジェクトは、12ヶ月以降も継続して資金を必要とします。この点については、リスク分析のセクションで、将来の資金はチームメンバーの誰かが獲得することになると述べています。キャサリン・オルステッドの資格と経験を検討した結果、このプロジェクトが成功する可能性は非常に高いと思われ、提案のマイルストーンの中にも目標として含まれています。全体的に、この計画は詳細で現実的であり、どのように実行されるかがよく説明されているので、この提案が成功する可能性が高いことに強く同意します。
f6_assessments.q2: すべてのマイルストーンを含むロードマップは詳細で、よく考えられており、達成することが現実的であると思われます。成功を定義するための評価基準とKPIは存在しますが、あまり具体的ではありません。これは、新しい空間での新しいツールであるため、ある意味では理解できますが、進捗状況を適切に把握するためには、いくつかの具体的なKPIが必要です。例えば、このプロジェクトによって10以上のDAOがCardanoに誘致されるという指標があります。これはどのように判断されるのでしょうか？DAOごとに提案されたツールで少なくとも1つの契約が成立することでしょうか。残念ながらこれは定量化されておらず、ほとんどの評価指標もそうです。さらに、進捗状況を確認するための手段も明示されていません。このチームにとって、これを実施することは難しいことではないと思いますが、進捗状況を確認できる場所を明確に定義することは有益です。とはいえ、目標はきちんと設定されており、数値化されてはいないものの、適格なものでした。最も重要なのは、それらが提案の中で無視されていないことです。したがって、この提案書は、目標達成の進捗状況を評価するのに十分な情報を提供していると私は考えます。

f6_assessments.q0:
This team want to build a DAO for DAO-related jobs and tasks. Therefore, this proposal is within the challenge goal. The funds are dedicated to deliver a POC within three months. 
If a job-related Dao runs on Cardano it could help to attract specifically skilled people to work for Cardano-related DAOs, so there is potential for a positive impact for the entire Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has the relevant experience to execute this proposal. a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon, also in technical realization. 
Budget seems sensible and has been broken down in identifiable items. The timeline provided to complete the project seems fair. With the given information I think it is highly likely that this proposal (MVP-Version) will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon. Also they have provided key performance indicators. To further improve auditability for the community I suggest to add a documentation source where the community can access and observe the progress of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: DAOJob provides a Cardano-integrated platform to support DAOs finding people to perform various tasks, as well as many foreseen features longer term, such as Dispute Resolution, Project/Task Management, etc.  Presumably DAOJob is a play on "day job", which I think is quite clever.  As someone who is excited to see Cardano grow, and especially for it to become a/the key ecosystem for DAOs in future, I think the proposed project has great potential to help scale up DAO activity in the Cardano ecosystem.  As a bonus, I think the background of one proposer (Governor of H.E.R. DAO) makes it highly likely that this project will also positively impact the Cardano ecosystem in terms of inclusiveness and diversity, which is really needed.
f6_assessments.q1: Both proposers have impressive and valuable experience, background and connections in many relevant spaces.  I was initially concerned, however, that the team appears to lack technical ability to execute on the project.  I was also concerned that Milestone 1.3 is about recruiting for technical talent, while Month 2 includes Milesstone 2.1, which includes identifying the appropriate tech stack, *after* recruiting technical expert/consultant.  Presumably we can infer that this person will not necessarily build the prototype, but rather "consult" on design, stack, etc.  I also assume that the Budget item called "Technical Architecture" is intended for paying that consultant, though this is not clear from the proposal.  With the benefit of doubt and given that the Budget is only for the first three months and it is clear that further fundraising and recruiting will be required beyond that, I feel more comfortable that the proposers can feasibly execute on the proposed project's first three months.  I also think that the proposers are well connected and therefore well positioned for recruiting when the time comes.  I wonder if the proposers are aware of https://discoverdaos.com/ and how it relates it to DAOJob.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget is for three months, and the Milestones and Deliverables set out for the first three months seem mostly reasonable and realistic.  Furthermore, I think the proposers could make the case that the deliverables can be documented for accountability and transparency.  However, the proposal's definition of success and KPIs are more focused on later stages of the project, beyond the currently proposed three months.  Furthermore, those KPIs are stated rather vaguely, with little discussion of how they can be measured or what measured values would be considered "success".  I am giving an Agree (4) rating on the basis that I think the three-month milestones and deliverables can provide sufficient accountability, even though that is not how the proposal addresses the question.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal states that the need for contributors to DAO Space will not be fulfilled by current job boards. The purpose of this DAO job board is to offer an optimized HR tooling for the specific needs of DAO. The description of the solution is convincing, and the target of this proposal is to translate it in a proof of concept. 
In a further application, I recommend that the proposal includes evidence about the problem itself, i.e. the lack of effective tooling to manage DAO related jobs, which I cannot confirm only based on my own knowledge.
The proposal goal does meet the challenge main objective to facilitate the development of DAO infrastructures on Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
The 2 teammembers are identified by their linkedIN project and gather a relevant experience in human ressources and business development. The solution is well defined and so are the conditions of success. The proposal gives confidence that DAO specific needs are well understood.
3 main risks are identified, starting with recruiting of the technical consultants required to implement the proposal. For all risks, a compelling risk mitigation action plan is presented. Considering the risk that the technical consultant/skills are not yet embedded in the team, I grade feasibility with a score of 4.
I'm very confident that this project will be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
A quite precise budget breakdown is presented. Funds are requested to reach to proof-of-concept stage after 3 months, which reduce the risk for community if some. After PoC stage, an application to a coming Catalyst round will be made.
Detailed intermediate milestones are listed, and a roadmap is presented for the full project up to full launch.
Many relevant Kpis are listed, ensuring that the impact on Cardano's DAO environment will be accurately monitored.
Budget allocation is detailed enough to enable a monitoring of the project up to PoC stage.
Based on the given information I grade auditability with a score of 5.

f6_assessments.q0: A successful job creation tool for DAOs is an important part of the infrastructure needed for DAOs to operate successfully on Cardano. Proposal would be fully scalable to support any number of DAOs once a launched product is available. KPIs do not directly address a key KPI of the challenge (is ADA in DAO fees > ADA spent on funding) but potential use case of product suggest this would be likely if successful.
f6_assessments.q1:
Milestones for both the 3 month funded period and 12 month road map seem viable. Team has strong experience in the ecosystem, in HR functions specifically, and in product development. The team also seems to have good networks to recruit talent to work on this project. Multiple plausible routes suggested for follow up funding gives good likelihood of ongoing product development/launch if a successful product can be built. 
Budget is stated to be intentionally lean. It does appear to be a comparatively low rate for developers which may exacerbate stated risk around immediate hiring requirement, though potentially mitigated by teams network and high potential of ongoing funding. Team has another funding proposal which references this proposal and states DAOJob will proceed regardless of funding success so it's possible this budget concern is unlikely to hinder successful outcome
f6_assessments.q2:
Multiple monthly milestones for 3 month funded period. Post funding roadmap has goals defined which would not be difficult to attach KPIs too if funded in a future round.
Budget audit is simple

f6_assessments.q0: Under the heading of "not yet existing tools" this seems to fit well.  It also drives the key metrics to increase DAO transactions that generate ADA fees, and would entice DAO to use Cardano as a platform for governance.  I am not sure I entirely understand a couple of the suppositions, such as "HR is the engine of any DAO". but I understand that certain types of DAOs would greatly benefit from decentralized HR tools.
f6_assessments.q1: I would rate this more highly, except it lacks a technical lead, as noted, and likely underestimates the technical effort required to move this project forward.  Two months at $2,500 / month for an outside technical resource to develop the architecture would seem to me to be a major barrier to success.  Personally, I would rate the likelyhood of success as perhaps a four or a five if it had a higher proposal amount that reflected what would seem to be a more realistic estimate of the technical aspects.  It's entirely possible that the architecture is either more simple than I surmise, or that resources are more readily available to do this work than I have experienced.  The latter would be ironic given the nature of the proposal.  ;-)
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal seemingly reflects in its detailed KPIs the long history of management and implementation enumerated in the CVs.

solution: DAOJobは、Web2配信チャンネルとシームレスに統合するDAOネイティブなタスク＆ジョブボードです。
experience: 神経科学と分散型技術の倫理学で博士号を取得、元SingualrityNETの人事部長、15年間のベンチャー構築と企業開発の経験を持つ。
